snippet: Images of billowing tear gas and explosions used in response to protests in Ferguson, Mo., have spurred a broad call from across the political spectrum for the demilitarization of police.
abstract: Images of billowing tear gas, explosions and armored vehicles used in response to protests in Ferguson, Mo, over fatal police shooting of Michael Brown have spurred calls from across political spectrum for demilitarization of police; such opposition amounts to sharp change in tone in Washington, where federal government programs for military equipment have been popular since Sept 11 terrorist attacks.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MATT APUZZO
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Ferguson, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Images of billowing tear gas and explosions used in response to protests in Ferguson, Mo., have spurred a broad call from across the political spectrum for the demilitarization of police.

headline.main: In Wake of Clashes, Calls to Demilitarize Police
headline.print_headline: In Wake of Clashes, Calls to Demilitarize Police
